TopicTitle: Will you Grind or Dare in Career mode?

Articles.Content: from the few .24 videos we have their seem to be as a large generalization contracts that are for money solely and contracts that are more daring to complete such as landing on a Celestial body for instance that offer huge rewards. What will you guys/gals primarily use to get your money in career mode?
DO it the Kerbal way! Fast and dangerous!
I imagine it'll be a balancing act; you do contracts for "the man" and then use the profits to explode stuff.
I will grind Dare contracts.

Dare.

Grinding is boring. If a mission is too grindy I'll attach extra things/do more things at once until it becomes dare.
I'll try to complete several contracts with one vessel. And then accept some more contracts and use the same vessel to complete them.

quick answer for me is EVERYTHING however i'm probably going to end up doing more of the a grind play-through because ill want to do a bug dumb rocket for any of my other missions.

just to point something out we are probably going to run our of those grinding missions after a while and we might be forced into taking the more difficult missions but i don't know
I'm planning on turning off all the revert and save functions, so basically everything I do will be a big risk.
Depending on how the difficulty turns out I'm planning on doing some 'grind' missions to get the funds together for a really big 'dare' mission.
I'll do grind missions while I'm doing a dare mission
Depends on the missions ... i.e. how grindy or daring they are

Daring. I'm also planning on turning off the save function. Some of my best memories are from playing the early versions of this game which didn't have a save function. The tension and the payoff were both awesome

Ofc Daring. Grinding is usually an issue when you can't do something riskier and/or more profitable. And you don't get more risky than kerbal space program.

I'm planning to go iron man mode in my new 0.24 safe. At least as long as it stays fun.

I'm planning on turning off all the revert and save functions, so basically everything I do will be a big risk.

This so much of this XD this will make even grinding missions "difficult" and more fun
I'll probably start of serious then slowly degrade into crazy contraptions and elaborate plans.
I'm planning on going the Danny route and just accept everything.

If it turns out like the mission extended mod,

You will inevitably be doing a lot of the easy missions to get enough money to do the more challenging ones.

I`ll do both. I`ll accept every mission I have the capability to do with the parts I have unlocked.

Lots of returning parts to KSC.

I`ll probably download a mod to reduce cash payouts, it seems really easy.
I'm tempted to start off Career Mode by trying to clear all the starting contracts at once.
I'm pretty sure I'll go one way or the other depending on my mood and how recently I've gone which way. I'm pretty sure that I'll go through the new tech tree at least twice by the end of the month.
I wanna be as stringent as possible. If I have to do a rescue mission, I'll bring the claw with me to pick up the fuel-less ship.
My plan is to combine as many contracts as I can into as few missions as can. Orbit the moon AND rescue this kerbal stranded in orbit? Let's go!
I will be accepting every contract and doing as many in each flight as I can, with a preference for those that will expire soon.
This game is all about taking big risks and pushing the limits of your tech. That or I am playing wrong...
Gotta be daring! We are KERBONAUTS, and we make EXPLOSIONS!
